works.complaint:
This page is a serious breach of privacy by displaying
 
the full private address of myself and my colleagues. While the document
it  
shows is a semi-public document, it is normal practice to conceal those  
details and only list the suburb and country.  It is therefore possible  
that they are misusing their access to that information, whether by  
accident or intent.

Google search further inadvertently violates my privacy by showing this  
page as the first result when searching for my surname and suburb, with my
 
full address shown in the page extract. I believe that this could also  
breach Australian privacy laws, as the information is not intended to be  

used in that way and such permission has not been granted (and is hereby  

expressly revoked). These are also search terms (ie name and suburb) that 

are likely to be used when trying to find information about a person,  
making it reasonably likely that continued publication could lead to  
negative consequences.

While it may be uncertain whether they can host the full document in their
 
jurisdiction, Google has a presence in Australia and so it certainly
should  
not be indexed in this way (with the private details shown on Google's  
search result).

I request that this page be removed from indexing.
